definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Both the general names and the proper names are the important parts of the Zhuang geograpnical names system.
sentences.chinese: 通名和專名是壯語地名詞彙系統的重要內容。

sentences.english: Chinese herbal names belong to professionals, and in terms of a large proportion.
sentences.chinese: 中藥材名稱屬於專名，在名詞中佔有很大的比例。

sentences.english: Researching proper names is still continuing now.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上關於專名的研究一直持續到現在。

sentences.english: Proper name and reference are two basic concerns in the philosophy of language.
sentences.chinese: 專名問題及指稱問題是語言哲學的基本問題。

definition: rime dictionary (ancient type of Chinese dictionary that collates characters by tone and rhyme rather than by radical)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
